description: Creates a new lifecycle configuration for the bucket or replaces an existing lifecycle configuration.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: An attacker could manipulate lifecycle configurations to delete, transition, or obscure data, effectively impairing defensive mechanisms by reducing the visibility or availability of critical data.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.technique: T1537 - Transfer Data to Cloud Account
unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Manipulating lifecycle configurations could facilitate the movement of data to different storage locations or accounts, enabling data exfiltration or staging of information.
Lifecycle configurations could be altered to move data into encrypted storage, rendering it inaccessible as a form of impact, effectively denying access to the legitimate users.
An attacker might adjust lifecycle configurations to archive or obscure files, making them harder to detect or stage them for later exfiltration, thus evading detection.

incidents.description: New tactics and techniques for proactive threat detection

securityImplications: Attackers might use PutBucketLifecycle to add a lifecycle that deletes data after one day.
